Pre-Game Insights: Brooklyn Nets come into the matchup against Milwaukee Bucks as losers of three games in a row.
The Bucks are 15-13 against Eastern Conference opponents.
Milwaukee is third in the NBA with 35.1 defensive rebounds per game led by Giannis Antetokounmpo averaging 9.6.
The Nets are 6-17 against Eastern Conference opponents.
Brooklyn is 8-14 against opponents with a winning record.
The Bucks are shooting 47.8% from the field this season, 0.9 percentage points lower than the 48.7% the Nets allow to opponents.
The Nets average 14.6 made 3-pointers per game this season, 0.7 more makes per game than the Bucks allow.
Antetokounmpo is averaging 32.6 points, 11.6 rebounds and six assists for the Bucks.
D'Angelo Russell is averaging 12.7 points and 4.8 assists for the Nets.

In their last 10 games, the Bucks are 6-4, averaging 110.8 points, 43.7 rebounds, 25.6 assists, 8.8 steals and 4.0 blocks per game while shooting 46.9% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 109.0 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Nets are 2-8, averaging 103.5 points, 40.4 rebounds, 24.1 assists, 8.1 steals and 3.3 blocks per game while shooting 43.6% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 112.5 points.
Injuries for the Bucks include AJ Green (day to day, calf), Khris Middleton (day to day, ankle), and Giannis Antetokounmpo (day to day, knee).

Injuries for the Nets include Ziaire Williams (day to day, knee), Bojan Bogdanovic (day to day, foot), Cam Thomas (day to day, hamstring), Trendon Watford (day to day, hamstring), Maxwell Lewis (day to day, leg), De'Anthony Melton (out for season, ACL), and Noah Clowney (day to day, back).
